data.title: .git file missing; can't clone

I tried cloning the wiki locally so I have offline access to it, but the .git file the page refers to is missing.

https://github.com/okamstudio/godot.wiki.git gets a 404 error.

data.title: Stack underflow when running game in editor on Fedora Linux
data.body:
When running a game (any game) in the editor, it gets a stack underflow and hangs at the Godot logo. I am using Fedora 20 and the 1.0 binary from the website.

I think this is related to the debug mode it uses in the editor. I can run games outside of the editor, even in the project select menu, but I'd like to be able to access the convenience of and tools available in the editor.

Please let me know if there is more information needed.

Screenshot:
![hqmrvt1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1912641/5593257/6ad10030-91d0-11e4-8f01-0f9a1c350af8.png)

data.title: Add camera dolly to Godot editor's 3d viewport
data.body:
Somehow I always manage to hit this issue, it happened to me using blender and maya, and now with Godot editor too, it's when the viewport's camera gets too close to its pivot. A workaround for this is to use the camera dolly zoom, which moves the camera in a direction perpendicular to the screen but uses a parameter independent of the camera's position with respect to its pivot. For that, the camera's focal length would be ideal, because it's independent of the aspect ratio, so the distance that the camera dolly is displaced would be the focal length multiplied by a constant factor, that constant factor could be configurable too.

![untitled-1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1840524/5592653/d342e6ca-91ac-11e4-95f0-523b9aed1f6b.jpg)

data.title: ESM shadow filter bugous apperance
data.body:
Something werd with the ESM shadow filter:

Project can be downloaded here: https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BwDtvsC8_NUGN0FKbHhQcXJIcWc/view?pli=1

Select camera and press preview in bottom view.

1) First - shadows look werd.
2) Do I see a anti-shadow on the floor, under the cube?
3) Press for ex. fastly ctrl+s (save) and see the animated shadows (??)
4) Re-open the project and move the camera along the coridor - the shadows ar jiggeling and flipping.
5) Re-open the project and RUN ir - see again animated shadows
6) Re-open project and move the cube around- shadows move very werd

data.title: Windows 64bit release template crashing
data.body:
Only happens when exporting on Windows 64bit with debug mode OFF:
App crashes instantly when mouse enters it's window. With debug mode on everything works fine as well as 32bit.
Even 1 scene with just empty Control node crashes.

Exception code: c0000005

data.title: Replace TileMapEditor floating tile palette with HSplitContainer.
data.body:
Replace TileMapEditor floating tile palette with HSplitContainer as used with GridMapEditor.
This fixes issue #1061.

data.title: Importer can not handle some e-values for vertex positions.
data.body: Importer can't tolerate low values that are very close to 0, expressed as Euler-values. So for example instead of 0.00001 blender can give 1e-5 if the value is small enough, and some values break, like for example -1.9684875951497816e-10   To reproduce just use this value in any .dae and see how the vertex is going towards infinity.

data.title: [request] add a .set_ord_at(pos,unicode) method to String
data.body:
Hi!

Godot stable 1.0.
I'm trying to set individual character in a string using its unicode value.

```
var my_str = "A"

var ord = my_str.ord_at(0)
ord += 1
my_str[0] = ord
```

The code above generates an _"Invalid set index '0'"_ error.
Is this normal, or is it a bug ?

**edit : corrected the variable name in the example above**

data.title: No file extension / No support for installation files in Linux.
data.body:
##### Description of Problem:

When downloading the "Linux" files from the godotengine webstie's [download page](http://www.godotengine.org/wp/download/) no file extensions are given for the files and the Linux system must make a best guess as to what the file is in order to open it. Linux attempts to guess and decides that it is some kind of "par2" file type which appears to be incorrect as opening it in a par2 application doesn't produce the expected results.

The two specific links on the godotengine page (shown above) that I'm assuming are for Linux are:
[godot_x11.64](https://godot.blob.core.windows.net/release/2014-12-15/godot_x11-1.0stable.64)
[linux_server.64](https://godot.blob.core.windows.net/release/2014-12-15/linux_server-1.0stable.64)

Those two links produce the same problem described above.

data.title: expose linear damping, angular damping and gravity scale in rigid body 2D and 3D
Blender/Maya zoom style.
data.body: In Blender or Maya, you can zoom by moving the mouse horizontally instead of vertically. I added option to switch between vertical/horizontal style for zooming. Personally, i like the horizontal style much more.

data.title: 3d RigidBody has unexpected behaviour when colliding with multiple StaticBodies
data.body:
It seems that when a RigidBody travelling at rather specific velocity impacts multiple StaticBodies (or other RigidBodies in static mode) at the same time, this allows the colliding object to go into places where it should not be physically able to fit.

In particular, the colliding RB can travel through very tiny slits between two SB's, or through intersections of two SB's collision volumes (with no "air" between them whatsoever).

[Here](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/19320633/collisionbug.zip)'s an unreduced testcase for the issue. In this game the player controls a character in third or first person mode, and can throw RigidBody cubes by clicking LMB. On the scene exists a set of white cubes with thin slits or intersections, and when the thrown cube is projected to hit the slits or the intersection, it "disappears", sliding through and being ejected on the cube's other side.

Enabling or disabling continous CD, collision monitor, or number of reported collisions doesn't seem to affect the problem.

You can see the intersection which should be shot at here:

![intersection screenie](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/19320633/godot-intersection.png)

I'll try to add a reduced zero-interaction test case a bit later.

data.title: Small typo in immediate_geometry.cpp
data.body:
In immediate_geometry.cpp there is a small typo. I think the method add_vertex argument should be  position, but the editor tells color.
ObjectTypeDB::bind_method(_MD("add_vertex","color"),&ImmediateGeometry::add_vertex);

data.title: Add Stop pause mode implementation
data.body: "Stop" pause mode was not working according bug reported in forum post ( http://www.godotengine.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=1255&p=5957#p5957 )

data.title: MinGW linker command too long
data.body:
When building on MinGW, godot would fail to link as the command line SCons passes is too long. This was where I tracked down the error and its fix: http://www.scons.org/wiki/LongCmdLinesOnWin32

I haven't tested it outside MinGW, so you'd need to check if it doesn't break the build on MSVC.

data.title: Missing Tilemap options
data.body: Options to control halfoffset and switch to an isometric grid etc are now missing from the tilemap node.

data.title: Tileset pallet
data.body:
The pallet tilebar for the currently selected tileset remains visible when switching to 'help' mode in the interface. This makes the help screen un-useable.

To reproduce:
a) Set up a 2d tilemap in a scene with a suitable tileset.
b) With the tilemap selected, click on the help tab.

data.title: Support for mobile IAPs and Ads.
data.body:
I'm currently playing around with Godot for a small mobile game. But the support for IAPs could be crucial.
My platform is Android at the moment.

data.title: RigidBody(2D) needs a function to apply torque and force to a specific point.
data.body:
There should be a function that takes:
- a point relative to the RigidBodys local transform and
- a force vector,
  and applies the force at that point, as if a rocket was attached there, pushing it.

This should result in not just movement, but correct rotation for force at that point relative to the center of the gravity.

It should be possible to easily add and remove forces that way, so one can toggle them with the input controls.

I think this could become the most-used function, as it frees people inexperienced with vector math from doing it manually. :)
(Its also essential for turning on and off separate rockets on the back of my car :)

data.title: X11: window titlebar close button does nothing
data.body:
1.0 Stable & current git, 64-bit.
Trying to close the Godot main window in X11 by clicking the close button on the window titlebar does not close the window (no prompt for close either).
This works as expected in Windows.
